intro: Galphimia angustifolia var. oblongifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf galphimia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves and clusters of bright yellow, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in well-drained soils. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability.
